name: Juan Garcia
experience: Over 10 years of experience cooking Mexican cuisine
bio: Juan Garcia is a passionate chef who has been cooking traditional Mexican cuisine for over 10 years. He loves experimenting with different ingredients and creating unique flavors that showcase the rich culture and history of Mexico.
ingredients: Poblano peppers, ground beef, garlic, onion, tomato sauce, oregano, cumin, salt, pepper
cookingMethod: Roast the peppers, sauté the beef with garlic and onion, stuff the peppers with the beef mixture, top with tomato sauce and spices, bake until bubbly and golden.

name: Maria Hernandez
experience: Trained in traditional Mexican cooking techniques at culinary school
bio: Maria Hernandez is a professionally trained chef who specializes in traditional Mexican cuisine. She learned the art of cooking from her grandmother and honed her skills at culinary school. Her dishes are always bursting with flavor and color.
ingredients: Tomatoes, onion, jalapeño, lime juice, cilantro, salt, pepper
cookingMethod: Chop the tomatoes, onion, and jalapeño finely, mix with lime juice and cilantro, season with salt and pepper.

name: Pedro Chavez
experience: Started cooking Mexican food as a teenager and never looked back
bio: Pedro Chavez has been passionate about cooking since he was a teenager. He started experimenting with Mexican recipes and never looked back. Today, he is a skilled chef who loves to share his love of food with others.
ingredients: Ground beef, lettuce, tomato, onion, cheddar cheese, tortilla chips, sour cream, salsa, guacamole
cookingMethod: Brown the beef, chop the lettuce, tomato, and onion, mix with cheese and chips, top with sour cream, salsa, and guacamole.

name: Sofia Ramirez
experience: Owned a successful Mexican restaurant for 15 years
bio: Sofia Ramirez is a veteran chef who owned and operated a popular Mexican restaurant for over 15 years. She has extensive knowledge of Mexican cuisine and loves to share her expertise with others.
ingredients: Corn husks, masa harina, chicken or pork, chili sauce, garlic, onion, cumin, oregano, salt
cookingMethod: Soak the corn husks, mix the masa harina with water, chicken or pork and spices, spread on the husks, fold and steam for an hour.
